title: Trace: List Index Out of Range
story: A beginner tried to access all elements in a list, but their code crashed with an IndexError. Can you diagnose the bug by reading the stack trace?
instructions: Analyze the stack trace and buggy code below. Answer the questions to demonstrate your understanding of the error.

hints.text: Look at the line number in the traceback - it points to the exact line that failed.
IndexError means you tried to access an index that doesn't exist in the list.

traceReading.stackTrace:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "main.py", line 3, in <module>
    print(numbers[5])
IndexError: list index out of range

questions.question: What type of exception was raised?
On which line number did the error occur?
What is the root cause of this error?
questions.correctAnswer: range(6) tries to access index 5, but list only has 5 elements (indices 0-4)
